title: Fed Signals Potential Rate Cuts Later This Year as Inflation Cools
author: Colby Smith
summary: Federal Reserve officials indicated they expect to cut interest rates once or twice this year, as new projections showed policymakers growing more confident that inflation is returning to their 2% target. The central bank held rates steady at 5.25-5.5% but the 'dot plot' revealed most officials anticipate at least one quarter-point reduction in 2024.
keyPoints: Fed holds rates steady at 5.25-5.5% range
Median projection shows one 25-basis-point cut in 2024
Core PCE inflation forecast lowered to 2.8% for end of 2024

expertOpinions.name: Jan Hatzius
expertOpinions.title: Chief Economist
expertOpinions.quote: We continue to expect the first cut in September, assuming inflation continues to moderate gradually.

expertOpinions.name: Diane Swonk
expertOpinions.title: Chief Economist
expertOpinions.quote: The Fed is trying to thread the needle - they don't want to declare victory too soon but also don't want to keep policy too tight for too long.

keyTakeaways: Fed remains cautious but has opened door to rate cuts
Markets slightly disappointed by conservative dot plot
Future decisions will depend heavily on inflation trajectory

significance: This marks a potential turning point in Fed policy after the most aggressive tightening cycle in decades. The guidance suggests policymakers are becoming more confident about inflation control while remaining attentive to economic risks.
